name: Hilton Tucson East

reviews.text: We stayed here and when we arrived the staff was very nice. We went up to our room which was okay, but had a very strong mildew smell. The bed was VERY comfortable, but the bathroom was very small. The TV was also almost comical it was so small in such a large armoire. The restaurant was pretty pricey but it was surprisingly really very good for dinner. Then the next morning we went down and our vehicle had been broken into along with 5 others. They managed to take our registration and found our extra house keys. One of the people who had there car broken into from the same area had the same thing taken and a phone call was made to there house around 1:45am to presumably check to see if anyone was home. We were told we needed to call our home town police, as we are from the Phoenix area two hours away, and have someone go change our locks if possible on our house. The hotel ended up giving us one night free out of three after we complained to the desk man. The hotel overall is supposed to be making upgrades, which are needed, and so if you were take away our vehicle experience I would say it was slightly overpriced for the quality of rooms.
reviews.title: Hotel Okay Security Not

likes.disliked: — The parking lot not well lit

reviews.title: Could have been better for a Hilton
reviews.text: Not a bad deal if you can get a good price. The room was rather small with a very little bathroom. Not much closet space. Bed was wonderful - up to Hiton standards. The TV didn't work, but maintenance fixed upon request. Biggest complains was air conditioning. It was either on or off with no ability to adjust. The thermostat didn't function so needed to just be turned off and on as the room warmed and cooled. A real pain. A nice touch was cookie and bottled water delivered in the evening.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet breakfast is way over priced, unless you are a Gold member and get a freebie. The bar and pool area is very nice. The lobby is large with several gathering areas. They put out an urn of coffee in the AM. While the staff was nice, the hotel still has a rather cold and sterile feel. This is probably due to recent renovations that may not be complete.
reviews.title: Great place with room for improvement

likes.liked: — friendliness of staff and cleanness of room

reviews.text: Good location on east side of town with restaurants, market, drug store very convenient. Easy drive to the east to Broadway trailhead at Saguaro National Park with visitor center and loop road just to the south.
reviews.title: What a dump!
Very nice hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hilton between 12/29/07 and 1/1/08. We ended up paying $60 through Priceline and definitely got a great deal for that. To keep things short here a few of the pros and cons:

This hotel is a diamond in the desert! Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. The place was easy to find and easy to get in and out. We were concerned because we had read about construction on I-10 in Tucson, but this hotel keeps you away from all that.
reviews.title: Had a Wonderful Time

reviews.text: Our room was good sized, clean and we got 2 Queen beds instead of the normal double sized beds. Our kids sure appreciated that.
reviews.title: Would Stay There Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the days we were there, the pool deck was being refurbished and I was so impressed with the hotel's proactiveness. They had an inside area all set for the kids with lemonade and snacks. They gave my husband and I free cocktails. And they arranged for us to use a nearby pool and transported me and kids to and from a gorgeous park that was nearby for a few hours in the afternoon. The next day, the pool was back and it was fabulous. The staff even brought out an air compressor to blow up my kids pool toys. We had a great time.
reviews.title: Great weekend stay

likes.disliked: — A little noisy in the hallways on the weekends

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mostly, I was impressed with how they anticipated what we would want before we had a chance to even realize what that was.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel, great staff. We are coming back during the holidays!
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hilton East on this trip to Tucson. We booked with hotwire and got an absolutely awesome rate. For the money we paid, I could not be more happy.
reviews.title: Comfortable Bed!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has undergone renovations recently and they could have been done better. I think it looks out of date all ready.
reviews.title: Needs more updates.

reviews.text: The front desk was exceptionally helpful, as was the bellboy at the front of the hotel. The lobby has a business center that provides free internet. The rooms also have internet access.
reviews.title: More like Motel 6 than a Hilton

reviews.text: The room was large and the bed was one of the most comfortable beds that I have slept on in a hotel in a very very long time.
reviews.title: overall good but need to pay more attention to the details!

likes.liked: — comfy bed and the breakfast at the hotel

reviews.text: The plasma TV in the room was a nice touch, but the smallish bathroom could be improved upon. The shower head didnt have the best water pressure and it took a while for the hot water to get through.
reviews.title: Really nice hotel

likes.liked: — Great value if you can get it thru Hotwire
likes.disliked: — Hotel was located quite a ways from I-10

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband for 3 days in late March while attending a wedding. The hotel is located in the newer part of town, fairly close (but not within walking distance) to the U of A. There is no breakfast included, that requires an upgrade, but there is a Bruggers Bagels a short drive away.
reviews.title: Nice Place, a little pricey"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: The property is nice, and newly renovated from what I understand. The rooms are quite large and the beds comfortable. The rooms were quiet. The pool area is nice. The parking lot is right out front, free, and just a short walk from the front door.
reviews.title: Great from check in to check out

reviews.text: Cons: The bathrooms are a little cramped and only have stand up showers, no baths, which I found odd. Despite the rooms being renovated, it seemed like they left the old shower heads which spray every which way. I found that annoying. The A/C cycled on and off all night and was pretty loud which caused a less than restful night's sleep. For a non-smoking floor, we found it to smell of smoke (the floor only, not the room itself). The thing that bothered me the most was a lot of light came into the room from the hallway underneath the door. It's like the door was missing a piece of weather stripping or something.
reviews.title: One of the best!!

likes.liked: — Location, food, helpful staff, clean and updated property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Despite my review being skewed toward the cons, it was a nice stay. I'm being picky because at a more expensive property I believe you should be. We paid $129/night which was the reduced wedding rate but if I were to pay a higher standard rate, I would want some things improved here.
reviews.title: Loved the bed!

likes.disliked: — The hotel looked older/out of date.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I stayed here for one night while revisiting some old college haunts & hiking sabino canyon. What a nice hotel. We stayed on the 4th floor, facing the mountains & Broadway. We did here road noise but turned the fan on the a/c on and we couldn't here a thing. The bed was really, really, really comfortable!! The rooms were newer, clean and welcoming. The hotel itself was equally clean & updated.
reviews.title: Tucson Hilton a Knockout!

description: A modern atrium lobby hotel with all-interior corridors in Tucson; this upscale hotel has a 7-story atrium lobby window that showcases the Catalina Mountain Range views. Guestrooms with King or 2 Queen beds and free Internet. Executive Level Rooms available with private key access floors, include access to the private lounge serving deluxe continental breakfast, all day snacks and beverages, and evening manager's reception with beer, wine and soda bar; additional amenities include turn down service and nightly snacks. Premium location close to Park Place Mall, attractions, business and shopping. Free parking. Restaurant, gift shop, pool, whirlpool, and exercise room.
